question: 答え
sourceMnemonic: You can guess this is a noun version of the kanji because the hiragana sticking out of it isn't an <ja>う</ja>-related sound or an <ja>い</ja>-related sound. So, what is the noun version of <kanji>answer</kanji>? It's also <vocabulary>answer</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is kun'yomi, but this is also the reading you learned with the kanji so you should be able to read this and then give your <ja>答え</ja> correctly.
